description: From French incitement, from Latin incitāmentum (“incentive; incitement”), from incitō (“urge; quicken; incite”, verb). Equivalent to incite +‎ -ment.

entries.meaning: A call to act; encouragement to act, often in an illegal fashion.
examples: The sheriff was constantly goading me into shooting trespassers, which should surely count as incitement at the very least.
